intro: Daviesia incrassata, commonly known as the serrated daviesia, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its woody shrub form. The plant produces showy, pea-like flowers that are typically pink or red, blooming in spring. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets, and it is often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Daviesia incrassata is adapted to dry conditions and is an important component of local ecosystems.
